Class NlsBundleHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.mmm.util.component.base.AbstractLoggableObject

  • public class NlsBundleHelper
extends AbstractLoggableObject
    Helper class to deal with NlsBundle interfaces.

    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

      • getQualifiedLocation

        public ClassName getQualifiedLocation(Class<? extends NlsBundle> nlsBundleInterface)
        This method gets the location of the ResourceBundle base name for the given NlsBundle interface.
        Parameters:
        nlsBundleInterface - is the NlsBundle interface.
        Returns:
        the fully qualified ResourceBundle base name for the given NlsBundle interface.

      • getKey

        public String getKey(Method method)
        Parameters:
        method - is the Method of a NlsBundle.
        Returns:
        the key of the Method (defaults to Method.getName() if not annotated with NlsBundleKey).

                                        Locale locale)
        Parameters:
        qualifiedBundleName - the qualified name of the ResourceBundle to load.
        locale - the Locale to translate to.
        Returns:
        the requested ResourceBundle.

        Returns:

      • toResourceBundle

        public ResourceBundle toResourceBundle(Class<? extends NlsBundle> bundleClass)
        Converts the given NlsBundle class to a ResourceBundle.
        Parameters:
        bundleClass - is the class reflecting a NlsBundle.
        Returns:
        a ResourceBundle with the key/value pairs of the given bundleClass for Locale.ROOT.
        Since:
        4.0.0

      • isNlsBundleMethod

        public boolean isNlsBundleMethod(Method method,
                                 boolean ignoreIllegalMethods)
        This method determines if the given Method is a regular NlsBundle-method.
        Parameters:
        method - the Method to check.
        ignoreIllegalMethods - - true if illegal methods (non NlsBundleMethods other than those defined by Object) should be ignored, false if they should cause an exception.
        Returns:
        true if the given Method is a legal NlsBundle method, false otherwise (e.g. for toString()).
